content:
To see the HTML and JavaScript code in action, you can create a new file in a text editor (such as Notepad on Windows or TextEdit on Mac) and save it with the ".html" extension, such as "index.html". Then, open the file in a web browser such as Google Chrome, Mozilla Firefox, or Microsoft Edge.

To do this, navigate to the location where you saved the file on your computer and double-click on it. This should open the file in your default web browser.

Alternatively, you can copy and paste the HTML and JavaScript code into an online code editor, such as CodePen, JSFiddle, or
